hadithEnglish: Allah's Messenger (may peace he upon him) gave glad tidings to Khadija bint Khuwailid رضی اللہ عنہا of a palace in Paradise.
chapterEnglish: The Book of the Merits of the Companions

hadithEnglish: Never did I feel jealous of any woman as I was jealous of Khadija رضی اللہ عنہا . She had died three years before he (the Holy Prophet) married me. I often heard him praise her, and his lord, the Exalted and Glorious, had commanded him to give her the glad tidings of a palace of jewels in Paradise: and whenever he slaughtered a sheep he presented (its meat) to her female companions.
chapterEnglish: The Book of the Merits of the Companions

hadithEnglish: Never did I feel jealous of the wives of Allah's Apostle ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌ ) but in case of Khadija رضی اللہ عنہا , although I did no, (have the privilege to) see her. She further added that whenever Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌ ) slaughtered a sheep, he said: Send it to the companions of Khadija I annoyed him one day and said: (It is) Khadija only who always prevails upon your mind. Thereupon Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌ ) said: Her love had been nurtured in my heart by Allah Himself.
chapterEnglish: The Book of the Merits of the Companions

hadithEnglish: This hadith has been transmitted on the authority of Abu Usama up to the slaughtering of a sheep, but he did not make mention of the subsequent words.
chapterEnglish: The Book of the Merits of the Companions

hadithEnglish: Never did I feel jealous of any wife amongst the wives of Allah's Apostle ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌ ) as I did of Khadija رضی اللہ عنہا, because he ﷺ often mentioned her, although I never saw her.
chapterEnglish: The Book of the Merits of the Companions

hadithEnglish: Allah's Apostle ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) did not marry any other woman till her (Khadija's) death.
chapterEnglish: The Book of the Merits of the Companions

hadithEnglish: Hala bin Khuwailid (sister of Khadija رضی اللہ عنہا ) sought permission from Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) to see him and he was reminded of Khadija's (manner of) asking leave to enter and (was overwhelmed) with emotions thereby and said: O Allah, it is Hala, daughter of Khuwailid, and I felt jealous and said: Why do you remember one of those old women of the Quraish with gums red and who is long dead-while Allah has given you a better one in her stead?
chapterEnglish: The Book of the Merits of the Companions

hadithEnglish: Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) having said: I saw you in a dream for three nights when an angel brought you to me in a silk cloth and he said: Here is your wife, and when I removed (the cloth) from your face, lo, it was yourself, so I said: If this is from Allah, let Him carry it out.
chapterEnglish: The Book of the Merits of the Companions

hadithEnglish: This hadith has been narrated on the authority of Hisham with the same chain of transmitters.
chapterEnglish: The Book of the Merits of the Companions

hadithEnglish: Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌ ) said to me: I can well discern when you are pleased with me and when you are annoyed with me. I said: How do you discern it? Thereupon be said: When you are pleased with me you say; No, by the Lord of Muhammad, and when you are annoyed with me, you say: No, by the Lord of Ibrahim. I said: Allah's Messenger, by Allah, I in fact leave your name (when I am annoyed with you).
chapterEnglish: The Book of the Merits of the Companions

hadithEnglish: This hadith has been reported on the authority of Hisham bin 'Urwa with the same chain of transmitters up to the words: No, by the Lord of Ibrahim, and he did not make mention of what follows subsequently.
chapterEnglish: The Book of the Merits of the Companions

hadithEnglish: She used to play with dolls in the presence of Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌ ) and when her playmates came to her they left (the house) because they felt shy of Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌), whereas Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌ ) sent them to her.
chapterEnglish: The Book of the Merits of the Companions

englishNarrator: It was narrated from Hisham with this chain of narrators:
hadithEnglish: I used to play with dolls in his house.
chapterEnglish: The Book of the Merits of the Companions

hadithEnglish: People sent their gifts when it was the turn of 'A'isha رضی اللہ عنہا seeking thereby the pleasure of Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌).
chapterEnglish: The Book of the Merits of the Companions

englishNarrator: A'isha رضی اللہ عنہا , the wife of Allah's Apostle ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) said:
hadithEnglish: The wives of Allah's Apostle ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) sent Fatima رضی اللہ عنہا, the daughter of Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌ ), to Allah's Apostle ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌). She sought permission to get in as he had been lying with me in my mantle. He gave her permission and she said: Allah's Messenger, verily, your wives have sent me to you in order to ask you to observe equity in case of the daughter of Abu Quhafa. She (`A'isha رضی اللہ عنہا) said: I kept quiet. Thereupon Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌ ) said to her (Fatima): O daughter, don't you love whom I love? She said: Yes, (I do). Thereupon he said: I love this one. Fatima رضی اللہ عنہا then stood up as she heard this from Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) and went to the wives of Allah's Apostle ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌ ) and informed them of what she had said to him and what Allah's messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌ ) had said to her. Thereupon they said to her: We think that you have been of no avail to us. You may again go to Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌ ) and tell him that his wives seek equity in case of the daughter of Abu Quhafa. Fatima رضی اللہ عنہا said: By Allah, I will never talk to him about this matter. `A'isha رضی اللہ عنہا (further) reported: The wives of Allah's Apostle ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌ ) then sent Zainab bin Jahsh رضی اللہ عنہا, the wife of Allah's Apostle ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌ ), and she was one who was somewhat equal in rank with me in the eyes of Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌ ) and I have never seen a woman more advanced in religious piety than Zainab رضی اللہ عنہا, more God-conscious, more truthful, more alive to the ties of blood, more generous and having more sense of self-sacrifice in practical life and having more charitable disposition and thus more close to God, the Exalted, than her. She, however, lost temper very soon but was soon calm. Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌ ) permitted her to enter as she (`A'isha رضی اللہ عنہا) was along with Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌ ) in her mantle, in the same very state when Fatima رضی اللہ عنہا had entered. She said: Allah's Messenger, your wives have sent me to you seeking equity in case of the daughter of Abu Quhafa. She then came to me and showed harshness to me and I was seeing the eyes of Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌ ) whether he would permit me. Zainab went on until I came to know that Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌ ) would not disapprove if I retorted. Then I exchanged hot words until I made her quiet. Thereupon Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌ ) smiled and said: She is the daughter of Abu Bakr رضی اللہ عنہ .
chapterEnglish: The Book of the Merits of the Companions

englishNarrator: A similar report (as Hadith no. 6260) was narrated from Az-Zuhri with this chain of narrators, except that he said:
hadithEnglish: (Aishah said...) ''When I started responding, I defeated her (in argument)."
chapterEnglish: The Book of the Merits of the Companions

hadithEnglish: Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) during his last illness) inquired: Where I would be tomorrow, where I would be tomorrow (thinking, that the turn of 'A'isha رضی اللہ عنہا was not very near) and when it was my turn, Allah called him to his Heavenly Home and his head was between my neck and chest.
chapterEnglish: The Book of the Merits of the Companions

hadithEnglish: Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) at the time of breathing his last was reclining against her chest and she was leaning over him and listening to him as he was saying: O Allah, grant me pardon, show mercy to me, enjoin me to companions (on High).
chapterEnglish: The Book of the Merits of the Companions

hadithEnglish: This hadith has been narrated on the authority of Hisham through another chain of transmitters.
chapterEnglish: The Book of the Merits of the Companions

hadithEnglish: I heard that never a prophet dies until he is given an option to opt the life of (this) world or that of the Hereafter. She further said: I heard Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌ ) say in his last illness in which he' died. I heard him saying in gruffness of the voice: Along with those persons upon whom Allah bestowed favours from amongst the Apostles, the testifiers of truth, the martyrs, the pious and goodly company are they (iv. 69). (It was on bearing these words) that I thought that he had been given choice (and he opted to live with these pious persons in the Paradise).
chapterEnglish: The Book of the Merits of the Companions

hadithEnglish: This hadith has been narrated on the authority of Sa'd with the same chain of transmitters.
chapterEnglish: The Book of the Merits of the Companions

englishNarrator: A'isha رضی اللہ عنہا the wife of Allah's Apostle ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌), reported:
hadithEnglish: He used to say: Never a prophet dies in a state that he is not made to see his abode in Paradise, and then given a choice. 'A'isha رضی اللہ عنہا said that when Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌ ) was about to leave the world, his head was over her thigh and he had fallen into swoon three times. When he felt relief his eyes were fixed at the ceiling. He then said: O Allah, along with the high companions (i.e. along with the Apostles who live in the most elevated place of the Paradise). (On hearing these words), I then said (to myself) He is not going to opt us and I remembered a hadith which he had narrated to us as he was healthy and in which he said: No prophet dies until he sees his abode in Paradise, he is then given a choice. 'A'isha رضی اللہ عنہا said: These were the last words which Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌ ) spoke (the words are): O Allah, with companions on High.
chapterEnglish: The Book of the Merits of the Companions

hadithEnglish: When Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) set on a journey, he used to cast lots amongst his wives. Once this lot came out in my favour and that of Hafsa رضی اللہ عنہا . They (Hafsa, and 'A'isha رضی اللہ عنہا ) both went along with him and Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌ ) used to travel (on camel) when it was night along with 'A'isha and talked with her. Hafsa رضی اللہ عنہا said to 'A'isha رضی اللہ عنہا : Would you like to ride upon my camel tonight and allow me to ride upon your camel and you would see (what you do not generally see) and I would see (what I do not see) generally? She said: Yes. So 'A'isha رضی اللہ عنہا rode upon the camel of Hafsa رضی اللہ عنہا and Hafsa رضی اللہ عنہا rode upon the camel of 'A'isha رضی اللہ عنہا and Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌ ) came near the camel of 'A'isha رضی اللہ عنہا. (whereas) Hafsa رضی اللہ عنہا had been riding over that. He greeted her and then rode with her until they came down. She ('A'isha رضی اللہ عنہا) thus missed (the company of the Holy Prophet) and when they sat down, 'A'isha رضی اللہ عنہا felt jealous. She put her foot in the grass and said: O Allah, let the scorpion sting me or the serpent bite me. And so far as thy Messenger is concerned, I cannot say anything about him.
chapterEnglish: The Book of the Merits of the Companions

englishNarrator: Anas bin Malik رضی اللہ عنہ reported:
hadithEnglish: Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌ ) as saying: The excellence of 'A'isha over women is like the excellence of Tharid over all other foods.
chapterEnglish: The Book of the Merits of the Companions

hadithEnglish: This hadith has been narrated on the authority of Anas bin Malik رضی اللہ عنہ through other chains of transmitters.
chapterEnglish: The Book of the Merits of the Companions
